document.masterDocTitle: New records of Reduviidae (Hemiptera: Heteroptera) from Colombia and other Neotropical countries

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New records of Reduviidae (Hemiptera: Heteroptera) from Colombia and other Neotropical countries

subSubSection.paragraph:
Agriocoris
Stål, 1866
is a monotypic genus, and
A. flavipes
is widely distributed (
Wygodzinsky 1948
). In specimens examined from Costa Rica and Panama the head and pronotum coloration pattern differ slightly from those of Colombia (
Fig. 28
). This variable chromatic pattern, as well as the variable shape of the humeral angles of the pronotum, was noted before by
Wygodzinsky ( 1948 )
. This species has been recorded from Nicaragua , Panama , Colombia , French Guiana , Surinam , Brazil , and Peru (Champion 1899 ;
Villiers 1971
;
Maldonado 1990
). Gil­Santana et al . ( 2003 ) recorded
Agriocoris
for the first time from Costa Rica and Bolivia , without giving any localities. Now, precise localities for Costa Rica , Colombia and Bolivia are provided, and for the first time the species is recorded also from Ecuador . In Colombia , it is restricted to lower elevations.
